docs.title: I'm new, where do I start?
docs.text: If you're interested in Warcry or Kill Team, join us for a tutorial at one of Xepher's Warhammer paint nights (click here to visit the Xepher calendar). For Warcry or One Page Rules, you're also welcome to show up on a game night and ask someone for a learning game. No materials required.

docs.title: 2026 Escalation League
docs.text: The Arcade Skirmish Club is proud to be holding its first escalation league! This is an event that takes place over time. We will all get the opportunity to purchase, build, and paint up an entire army. You’ll learn to play along the way, and by the end of the league you’ll have an entire painted army ready for battle!

docs.title: Important Info
docs.text:
How can I submit my progress?

Hobby progress form: Click here

Match report form: Click here

When is it?

January 1st - July 1st, 2026

How do I participate?

You will build and paint a full-scale army for a game of your choice over the course of 6 months. Each month you will earn points for building, painting, and playing with a new chunk of your army. Store credit will be provided for winners in several categories. See “Participating in the league” for full details.

Is there an entry fee?

There is no entry fee! We want this to be as accessible as possible.

Are 3D prints and proxies allowed?

For the escalation league, yes! We maintain a list of our recommended 3D printing vendors on this site: 3D Printing Vendors. You will have to double check with your desired gaming group to make sure proxies/prints will be allowed at regular game nights.

Are prizes awarded?

Yes, prizes will be awarded for several categories. See Awards for more details.

Can I use minis I've already built/painted?

Yes. The main audience of this league is looking to build and paint a full army they don't already have, but you can participate in whatever way you see fit. That being said, models that you build/painted before the league won't be eligible for building/painting points.

docs.title: Choose a Game and Army
docs.text: The first step to participation is to select a game system and army to build. The amount of points you’ll paint per month and the final army size is determined by the game system you are playing. See Game Specific Rules for more info.

docs.title: Gather Your Materials
docs.text: Once you’ve committed, it’s time to make sure you’re stocked up for all the hobbying ahead. Be it plastic kits, hobby supplies, or anything else, you can get your supplies for the escalation league from the Xepher store. Members of the arcade enjoy a 10% discount on all purchases. A sizable discount is available for those who want to purchase 6+ kits at once for their army, contact zeronxepher in discord for more details.

docs.title: Start Hobbying
docs.text: With the materials prepared to amass your army, you can start hobbying! See the details for your specific game for next steps.

docs.title: Game Specific Rules
docs.text: Below are the escalation rules for specific games. If you don’t have a game system in mind, One Page Rules (OPR) is a great fallback. It’s miniature agnostic, has free rules and an online army builder, smaller army sizes, and has an existing playerbase at Xepher. If you decide to play another game afterwards (ex. Warhammer 40k), your OPR sized army will be a great starting point.

docs.title: One Page Rules
docs.text:
Organized by NC OPR

Final army size of 3000 or 2000 points, Grimdark Future or Age of Fantasy. Miniature agnostic, build and paint whatever you want! 3D prints encouraged. If you want to have flexibility to play in the biggest tournaments, 3000 is recommended. Otherwise if you just want to start showing up to game nights, 2000 is more than enough. At any point you can decide to switch to 2000 if 3000 proves to be too much.

For tips on choosing an army, building a list, finding files, and more, join us in the NC OPR discord: https://discord.gg/Qae87Pbqfc

docs.title: Game nights
docs.text: You can bring your army to NC OPR game nights across the triangle. People will be happy to accomodate your list, no matter how many points it might be. There are two game nights a month at Xepher, happening every other Thursday night. See https://northcarolinaopr.com for more details. During the escalation league, Xepher game nights will have a special focus on the current point size of league participants.

docs.title: Where do I start?
docs.text: If you're looking to join us at club, you don't need anything to start! Just show up and we'll have everything you need. Once you're ready to invest in the game, I recommend starting with your own warband.

docs.title: Purchasing a Warband
docs.text:
You have two options for building a warcry warband. By far the easiest is purchasing a bespoke warcry team. These boxes contain everything you need to build a balanced 1k point list, and have a strong theme with fun synergies.

You can browse teams available for order at https://www.warhammer.com/en-US/warcry. Once you've found one that you like, use the order form pinned in the #warhammer channel of the Xepher discord to place an order with the arcade. This will get you a substantial discount over ordering direct from the Warhammer store.

If you're more willing to spend money on crafting a specific team, you can build a compendium team. These are teams that use models from Age of Sigmar and Warhammer Underworlds, which means they don't come bundled together in a way that's cohesive or cost-effective for warcry. Sometimes spearheads are good for this, sometimes not so much. If you go this route, feel free to post a question in the discord for more specific advice.

docs.title: Listbuilding
docs.text:
We play according to matched play battlepack rules. You can find the battlepack in the Useful Resources section, with full list building rules available on warcrier.net.

  1. Choose a faction.
  2. Choose up to three heroes from that faction.
  3. Choose any number of fighters from that faction (total fighter+hero count must be between 3 and 15)
  4. [Optional] Choose bladeborn fighters and heroes. Heroes may be included if they are in the same Grand Alliance. Once you add a Bladeborn hero, their accompanying fighters may be added as well.
  5. [Optional] Add divine blessings to get your points as close to 1000 as possible.

If your entire warband shares a faction runemark, you can use the Battle Trait for that faction. Otherwise, you must use the battle trait of their shared Grand Alliance instead.

docs.title: Guidelines
docs.text:
• Assume your opponent wants 1k matched play style, unless otherwise stated
  • Battle traits are allowed
  • Bladeborn fighters and Monsters are allowed
  • Divine Blessings are allowed

docs.title: How do I start?
docs.text: Anyone is welcome to join ongoing narrative play at any time. All you need to do is create a narrative warband roster, click here to visit warcrier for more details. Once you have it ready come to game night and ask your opponent if they'd like to play narrative, most people will be more than happy to play and help guide you through your first aftermath sequence.

docs.title: Guidelines
docs.text:
• Take time to craft your roster, paint, and name your models. It's more fun for everyone when everybody is invested in their team!
  • Try not to progress for more than twice a week. You can continue to play games with your narrative roster, but don't perform the aftermath sequence on games after your second. This is an effort to keep everyone at roughly the same place.
  • If your opponent has a quest battleplan to do, let them do it!
  • If you and your opponent both have a quest battleplan to do, roll off to choose.

docs.title: Is picking up treasure an action?
docs.text:
No, from Warcrier:

If at any point during a move action a fighter moves within 1" of a treasure token, the fighter can pick up that treasure. Remove the token from the battlefield. That fighter is now carrying that treasure. A fighter cannot pick up treasure if they are already carrying treasure. Fighters with the Monster runemark or Beast runemark cannot carry treasure.

docs.title: Can I pick up treasure if I'm within 1" of an enemy fighter?
docs.text: Yes, see above.

docs.title: How close do I have to be to control an objective?
docs.text:
3" from the center of the marker. So the control range of an objective is a 3" sphere with it's origin in the center of the marker.

Reference: Warcrier link

docs.title: Can I move here?
docs.text:
Yes, if:

  1. The fighter physically fits there.
  2. You can physically move your base to the destination. If you can't fit through a tight hallway, you can't make the move.

docs.title: If I have an enemy within 1" of me, can I shoot at someone else?
docs.text:
No.

Reference: Warcrier link

docs.title: Can I shoot at a target who is within 1" of an ally?
docs.text: Not unless you're within 3" of the target.

docs.title: Can I move within 1" of an enemy?
docs.text: Yes, as long as you start the move more than 1" from any other enemy fighter.

docs.title: Is a disengage a move action?
docs.text:
No.

Reference: Warcrier link

docs.title: Can I use a reaction if I've already activated?
docs.text:
No*, reactions cost one action to use.

* Unless you used Wait and have an action left

docs.title: Can I wait for my second action?
docs.text:
Strictly speaking yes, but this is equivalent to doing nothing. Wait only works if you use it as your first action, which allows you to activate that fighter with a single action at a later point.

Reference: Warcrier link

docs.title: 3D Printing Vendors
docs.text:
Arcade Skirmish Club events are 3d-print and proxy friendly. If you have a file you'd like to get printed, here are some local vendors who are willing to do that for you. Message them on discord for more details.

Generally you want miniatures printed in resin and terrain printed in FDM, but there are exceptions. Feel free to ask in discord if you need help deciding.
